questiontext.text: What is the best description of the difference between practical significance and statistical significance?

generalfeedback.text:
Language Dutch

Levels of Difficulty Easy

M&T Basics of quantitative research Basics of quantitative research

M&T BIS Default value

answer.text: Practical significance is about the strength of an effect, statistical significance is about the certainty with which you can say that the null hypothesis (H0: no effect exists in the population) is not plausible.
Practical significance is calculated based on the standard deviation, statistical significance is calculated based on the standard error (SE).
You use practical significance when testing significance based on the t-distribution, statistical significance when testing of significance based on the z-distribution.
Practical significance is what you use with small samples (sample size is 100 or smaller), statistical significance you use with large samples (n > 100).
